intro: Maytenus longipes, commonly known as the long-pedunculate mayten, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive elongated peduncles. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Maytenus longipes is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
